CAREER SUMMARY
July 2019 to date Contract Resources Oilfield Services LLC
Position: HR Manager
Develop and implement HR Strategies and initiatives aligned with the overall business strategy
Bridge management and employee relations by addressing demands, grievances or other issues
Manage the recruitment and selection process
Support current and future business needs through the development, engagement, motivation and preservation of human capital
Develop and monitor overall HR strategies, systems, tactics and procedures across the organisation
Nurture a positive working environment
Oversee and manage a performance appraisal system that drives high performance
Maintain pay plan and benefits program
Assess training needs to apply and monitor training programs
Report to management and provide decision support through HR metrics
Ensure legal compliance throughout human resource management
Mediates and conflict resolution on employee issues using current policies and disciplinary actions
Subject matter expert on UAE labour law regulations
Oct 2018 to July 2019 DarAlber Society
Position: HR Section Head
Feb 2016 to Sept 2016 Plan International
Position: HR Officer
Oct 2015 to Feb 2016 Tearfund UK
Position: Senior HR Officer
June 2014 to Nov2014 Saipem
Position: HR Officer
Sept 2011 to March 2014 RAF Foundation
Position: Head of HR & Administration
June 2007 to August China National Petroleum Corporation
Position: HR Executive
Volunteer Experience
HR Advisor – Global Forum on Migration and Development – Geneva
The GFMD is an informal, non-binding voluntary and government led process that marks the culmination of more than a decade of international dialogue on the growing importance of the linkages between migration and development.
HR Advisor – The Haven Night Shelter Welfare Organisation – South Africa
Provides temporary shelter, physical care, social welfare and family reunification services to adult homeless persons typically described as street people or vagrants in the Western Cape.
COMMENT
A diligent HR professional with 12+ years of experience with international exposure in United Arab Emirates, Switzerland, Iraq, Qatar, South Africa and Sudan. His unique strengths include agility, strategic thinking, execution, communication as well as collaboration. Demonstrated success across organisations spectrum (matrix or functional) and geographies.
Strengths
HR Strategic planning
HR Business Partner
HR policies and procedures
Organisation development
Learning & development
Employee relations
Performance management
Global mobility
Key Skills
Employee relations
Workforce planning
Grievance handling
Attrition management
Knowledge of HRIS
UAE labour law and regulations
IT / Technical Skills
Visio – org charts, flowcharts
Microsoft Office
MOHRE / ICP
HR SAP
Peoplesoft
For further information please contact Julie Smith on 01695 570 696 or email Julie.smith@johnston-vere.co.uk

career_advancement: Focus on building core technical skills
Seek mentorship from senior team members
Take on challenging projects to gain experience
